TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr G.O. PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
and as they appear from the documents , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE a deep recession undermined profitability across the entire financial sector and led to a banking crisis in DATE . The authorities took exceptional measures , such as takeovers , government assistance and temporary blanket guarantees to banks , to secure the stability of the financial system . In DATE ORG ( valtion vakuusrahasto , statens säkerhetsfond ) was established with a view to managing the banking crisis . In the state organisation chart ORG was subordinated to ORG until CARDINAL DATE when it was transferred to ORG .
The applicant is the former chief general manager of a bank , STS - Pankki Oy ( hereinafter “ the bank ” ) , which met severe financial difficulties .

In DATE ORG examined the bank ’s situation . Another bank , ORG , bought the majority of the STS - Pankki Oy ’s shares . According to the ORG agreement , however , the authority over the bank was entrusted to ORG . The bank changed its name to PERSON and its function was henceforth to administer unsettled loans and troublesome property . In DATE almost all the shares of ORG were sold for a nominal price and its name was subsequently changed to PERSON . The buyer was a property management corporation controlled by ORG .
Meanwhile , on the strength of the above ORG agreement ORG instructed the bank to institute compensation proceedings against a number of bank managers and directors .

On DATE the bank instituted CARDINAL separate proceedings against its former management , including the applicant , claiming compensation in the amount of MONEY ( ORG ) ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) . On DATE he was served with the summons . At the time , he was chairman of ORG , which did not form part of the Government but he resigned shortly afterwards . He founded his own business and started working as a business consultant . In DATE his assets were seized .

On DATE the ORG ( käräjäoikeus , tingsrätten ) , by CARDINAL separate judgments , found partly in favour of the plaintiff bank , ordering the applicant among others to pay jointly ORG CARDINAL ( about EUR CARDINAL ) plus interest from the service of the summons and legal costs .
On DATE ORG ( hovioikeus , hovrätten ) upheld the lower court ’s judgments .

On DATE the applicant requested that ORG produce documents from its meetings relating to the plaintiff bank ’s law suit against him . On DATE ORG refused the request arguing that the documents were of an internal nature and therefore confidential . On DATE ORG ( korkein hallinto - oikeus , högsta förvaltningsdomstolen ) overturned the decision .
On DATE ORG ( korkein oikeus , högsta domstolen ) reduced the joint liability to pay compensation to ORG CARDINAL ( some EUR CARDINAL ) .

On DATE in a debt recovery procedure , the Bailiff found that the applicant did not possess any considerable recoverable property . It also appears that the earlier debt recovery procedures in DATE and DATE had proved more or less unsuccessful .

In DATE the applicant contacted the plaintiff with a view to reaching a friendly settlement . Negotiations followed and a concrete settlement was being discussed . CARDINAL of ORG , a social NORP , issued an instruction to ORG to the effect that a friendly settlement should be achieved . ORG then presented the plaintiff bank ’s ORG with an instruction to the same effect .

On DATE the applicant and the plaintiff reached a friendly settlement as to the payment of compensation to the effect that the applicant would pay ORG CARDINAL ( some EUR CARDINAL ) . The settlement was signed by him and the plaintiff ’s chief executive , the latter having received the company ’s ORG authorisation .

The settlement led to a lively public debate according to which the above amount was far too low and to a request by a group of members of ORG , at DATE , for a police investigation into the applicant ’s financial affairs . The relevant social NORP Minister of Finance resigned at about this time .
On DATE ORG decided not to instruct PERSON to commence judicial proceedings with a view to having the friendly settlement declared null and void .

Following ORG judgment in the compensation proceedings , the plaintiff bank , on DATE , requested a police investigation into the underlying facts of the case . By a letter of DATE a public prosecutor , GPE , informed the plaintiff that he saw no reason to commence a pre - trial investigation against anyone in the bank ’s management on account of the events which had been the object of the compensation proceedings ( toimenpiteistä luopuminen , åtgärdseftergift ) .

Meanwhile and during the course of the above compensation proceedings , the plaintiff bank on the instruction of ORG requested , on DATE , that the police investigate whether the applicant had committed debtor ’s dishonesty or fraud . At the beginning of the autumn the police received the applicant ’s written submission . On DATE the plaintiff withdrew its request for an investigation . In their decision of CARDINAL DATE the police , finding that there was no appearance of any criminal activities , decided not to refer the case to the public prosecutor .

As noted above , at DATE a group of MPs requested a police investigation into the applicant ’s financial affairs , following the friendly settlement . On DATE a ORG , GPE , instructed the police to institute a pre - trial investigation ( tutkintakehotus , begäran om förundersökning ) into the applicant ’s financial affairs from DATE , inter alia in view of the fact that he had directed his income into current accounts with credit balances which he had kept below CARDINAL thus preventing any successful debt recovery procedure and he had paid the above ORG CARDINAL although on DATE he had not accounted for such assets in a debt recovery procedure .

On DATE the applicant was arrested and his office , home and DATE cottage were searched and documents were seized . He was released after TIME . He was questioned on DATE . The police also made inquiries with the applicant ’s customers with a view to finding out whether he had revealed all relevant information relating to his income during the investigation . The inquiries did not show that the applicant had withheld any such information . The case was subsequently transferred to ORG Prosecutor PERSON

In his decision of DATE ORG ( eduskunnan oikeusasiamies , riksdagens justitieombudsman ) found no reason to take measures on account of ORG actions before and during the compensation proceedings . The applicant had lodged a complaint as regards , among other things , the fact that a law firm engaged by ORG had , in DATE , hired a private investigator to look into the applicant ’s financial affairs . ORG found that the hiring of a private investigator in the present case was not dubious as he had only produced public tax information .

Meanwhile , in his decision of DATE ORG ( valtionsyyttäjä , statsåklagaren ) PERSON charged the applicant with embezzlement . He however waived charges of debtor ’s dishonesty or debtor ’s fraud due to the lack of evidence . Nonetheless , in his decision he drew the applicant ’s attention to the fact that the case might be reviewed by a higher prosecuting authority in accordance with LAW , LAW ( CARDINAL ) of LAW .

On DATE an MP lodged a complaint with ORG ( valtakunnansyyttäjä , riksåklagaren ) on account of ORG Prosecutor PERSON ’s decision not to prosecute the applicant for debtor ’s dishonesty , accusing the former of having failed to take into account the fact that the applicant ’s way of spending money had weakened his financial position and thereby damaged the bank ’s interests .
On DATE the Prosecutor General informed the applicant that he had decided , on the presentation of ORG Prosecutor PERSON , to review PERSON ’s decision .
On DATE State Prosecutor PERSON invited the applicant ’s submission as to the issues raised in the complaint of the MPs . It was received on DATE .
On DATE ORG decided that charges be brought against the applicant for debtor ’s dishonesty . The decision was signed by ORG PERSON

As noted above on DATE State Prosecutor PERSON brought charges against the applicant for aggravated embezzlement committed in DATE . On DATE ORG rejected the charges . It appears that the acquittal became final .

Meanwhile , on DATE , ORG Prosecutor PERSON , acting on the strength of the Prosecutor General ’s decision of DATE , brought charges against the applicant for aggravated debtor ’s dishonesty committed during the period from CARDINAL DATE to DATE . In short , he was charged with having deliberately weakened his financial position thereby damaging the above plaintiff ’s interests .
On DATE the ORG invited the applicant ’s written observations by DATE .

Before replying to the charges , the applicant argued that they should be ruled inadmissible on the ground that the police on DATE had decided not to refer the case to the public prosecutor . Further , ORG Prosecutor PERSON had decided , on DATE , not to prosecute . No new facts had been established between the decision not to prosecute and ORG Prosecutor PERSON ’s subsequent decision to bring charges . On DATE ORG rejected the complaint .

The applicant denied the charges , arguing that he had never been insolvent . In the hearing ORG received oral testimony from the applicant , CARDINAL witness for the prosecution and CARDINAL witnesses for the defence . It also received testimony from a witness on the initiative of both the prosecution and the defence . Having received the evidence , ORG noted that it had no reason to doubt the credibility of the oral testimony . Further , it considered that the case turned on a judicial assessment of the undisputed facts .
On DATE ORG , finding that the applicant ’s conduct did not fulfil the constitutive elements of debtor ’s dishonesty , rejected the charges .

The public prosecutor and the complainant appealed . In his observations in reply the applicant , referring to LAW , requested that the charges be ruled inadmissible on the ground that an examination of the charges was in violation of the ne bis in idem principle .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request that ORG give oral testimony regarding his procedural complaint as ill - founded .
On DATE ORG upheld ORG ruling of DATE in so far as the procedural complaint was concerned .
On DATE ORG held a hearing during which it received oral evidence from the applicant and a number of witnesses .

On DATE ORG convicted the applicant of aggravated debtor ’s dishonesty and sentenced him to a suspended term of CARDINAL months’ imprisonment . It however rejected the compensation claim referring to the wording of the friendly settlement according to which the parties had no longer any claims against each other .
On DATE ORG refused leave to appeal .
Section CARDINAL of the Act on Public Prosecutors ( CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) reads :
The following are public prosecutors :
CARDINAL . the Prosecutor General and the Deputy Prosecutor General ;
CARDINAL . a State Prosecutor ; and
CARDINAL . a District Prosecutor and a Prosecutor for GPE .

Section CARDINAL of the LAW provides that the prosecution service is headed by ORG , who is appointed by the President of GPE LAW provides that ORG is appointed by the Government on the nomination of ORG .
The Prosecutor General heads the central administration body for public prosecutors , ORG ( valtakunnansyyttäjänvirasto , statsåklagarämbetet ) , and he or she appoints the ORG .

His or her statutory duties include supervision of the subordinate prosecutors . Although a public prosecutor is independent in the consideration of the charges ( section CARDINAL of the Act on Public Prosecutors ) , ORG has the authority to take over for consideration any case from a subordinate prosecutor or to assign a subordinate prosecutor to prosecute a case where ORG has decided that a charge be brought . The decisions of the prosecutors are subject to complaint lodged with ORG , who is competent to reopen a case if he or she so decides .

In ORG there are a number of ORG Prosecutors , who have jurisdiction as prosecutors throughout the country . Their primary task is to see to the prosecution of criminal matters of the greatest significance to the society as a whole .
The ORG Prosecutors do not in their own right hold any superior authority over the local prosecutors , but some of the authority of ORG may be delegated to them .
LAW , section CARDINAL of LAW provides that the public prosecutor is to bring charges if there is a prima facie case against the suspect .

LAW , LAW ( CARDINAL ) provides that if the public prosecutor has decided not to prosecute , he or she may withdraw the decision only if there is new evidence which shows that the decision has been based on essentially incomplete or erroneous information . Subsection CARDINAL provides that a superior prosecutor has the right to reopen the case in accordance with the specific provisions thereon .

Section CARDINAL of the Act on Public Prosecutors provides that ORG is independent in the assessment of the charge being considered by him or her , unless otherwise provided by LAW . LAW provides that ORG is the superior of all public prosecutors . He or she may decide to take up for consideration any matter belonging to a subordinate prosecutor and to assign a subordinate prosecutor to prosecute a case where ORG has decided on the charge . In addition , ORG may allot a case to a subordinate prosecutor for the assessment of the charge . A re - evaluation by ORG is often brought about by a complainant being dissatisfied with the result of the first consideration of the charges .
There is no statute of limitation as regards the review of a matter by ORG .
